item.title: Ticket #535 (Add note to options-permalink.php on properly ending URI structure) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger

item.title: Ticket #535 (Add note to options-permalink.php on properly ending URI structure) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Not properly terminating custom permalinks, using either %postname% or %post_id%, can lead to problems (refer: ​http://wordpress.org/support/3/18325). A notice to that effect should be added to options-permalink.php.

item.title: Ticket #529 (Markup for linking from one post to another) updated
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
Plugin? Yes - see link in description and notes in Additional information. I don't doubt that there are other implementations as well.

As for the core: Make it as simple as possible. But no simpler.

If enough people want a feature, it should be standard. I imagine there are exceptions to this sweeping generality, but I think good soft linking is a valuable feature. Whether or not enough people agree with me, I don't know. I do, however, think most people link from post to post; these links should be made as robust as possible, thereby eliminating difficult support issues down the road ("I have to do _what_ with MySQL?")

item.title: Ticket #534 (Users can access wp-config.php from the template edition page) updated
item.dc:creator: trbecker

item.title: Ticket #534 (Users can access wp-config.php from the template edition page) created
item.dc:creator: trbecker
item.description: Users can access the wp-config.php file from the template edition page in the administration. This way, unauthorized users can have access to the mysql server, if it have an external port open.
